{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents provide information on breast-feeding experiences of women with type I diabetes, the relationship between breast-feeding and development of type 1 diabetes mellitus, risk determinants for early-onset type 1 diabetes mellitus independent of islet cell antibodies and early introduction of cow's milk, and prevention or delay of type 1 (insulin-dependent) diabetes mellitus in children using nicotinamide. From these documents, it can be inferred that breast-feeding may not have a direct protective effect against the development of type 1 diabetes. The study on breast-feeding experience of women with type I diabetes found no differences in clinical characteristics between diabetic subjects and controls. Another study found no association between duration of breast-feeding and subsequent risk of developing type 1 diabetes.", "answer_choice": "B"}
